alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 14 at 10:12AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 115 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. Minor and shallow debris flows over recent burn areas like the Bobcat, Ranch 2, Dam, Palisades, Elsemere, Townsley. * WHERE...Most of Los Angeles County * WHEN...Until 115 PM PST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Flooded roadways. River or stream flows are elevated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1009 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to heavy rain. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Malibu, Topanga, Burbank, Pasadena, Azuza, Santa Clarita, and Mount Wilson. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas. The rain will likely trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
